annotation.spannedText: Vaccines offer the greatest protection against specific infectious diseases caused by a virus or bacteria

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines offer the greatest protection against specific infectious diseases caused by a virus or bacteria

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines are made from chemically-altered forms of the virus or bacteria that won’t cause a disease, but stimulate the body’s immune system to produce antibodies against the disease instead

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines are made from chemically-altered forms of the virus or bacteria that won’t cause a disease, but stimulate the body’s immune system to produce antibodies against the disease instead

annotation.spannedText: Antibodies work by destroying the disease-causing virus or bacteria if it tries to infect the body, then “remembers” it, to fight against the disease in the future

classMention.mentionClass: Antibodies work by destroying the disease-causing virus or bacteria if it tries to infect the body, then “remembers” it, to fight against the disease in the future

annotation.spannedText: The protection provided by vaccines gradually decreases over time and is specific to each vaccine. This is why boosters are required

classMention.mentionClass: The protection provided by vaccines gradually decreases over time and is specific to each vaccine. This is why boosters are required

annotation.spannedText: not all pets need all vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: not all pets need all vaccines

annotation.spannedText: The vaccines your pet needs depends on their age, health status, lifestyle, and what diseases are present in our area

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccines your pet needs depends on their age, health status, lifestyle, and what diseases are present in our area

annotation.spannedText: Vaccination is the most effective way to prevent the transmission of the disease in animals

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination is the most effective way to prevent the transmission of the disease in animals

annotation.spannedText: Vaccinating animals is the best safeguard to prevent the spread of rabies to human as well

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccinating animals is the best safeguard to prevent the spread of rabies to human as well

annotation.spannedText: Because of the serious health risks to both pets and humans, the rabies vaccine is required by law in most areas of the country, including Virginia

classMention.mentionClass: Because of the serious health risks to both pets and humans, the rabies vaccine is required by law in most areas of the country, including Virginia

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine also protects against hepatitis, parvovirus, and parainfluenza

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccine also protects against hepatitis, parvovirus, and parainfluenza

annotation.spannedText: We recommend all of our canine patients who fit this criteria be vaccinated against leptospirosis

classMention.mentionClass: We recommend all of our canine patients who fit this criteria be vaccinated against leptospirosis

annotation.spannedText: We highly recommend all of our canine patients be vaccinated against Lyme Disease

classMention.mentionClass: We highly recommend all of our canine patients be vaccinated against Lyme Disease

annotation.spannedText: We strongly recommend the FeLV vaccine for all cats that spend any time outdoors

classMention.mentionClass: We strongly recommend the FeLV vaccine for all cats that spend any time outdoors

annotation.spannedText: the vaccines your pet needs depends on their age, health status, lifestyle, and what diseases are present in our area

classMention.mentionClass: the vaccines your pet needs depends on their age, health status, lifestyle, and what diseases are present in our area

annotation.spannedText: strong communication between you and your LVH veterinarian is the key to getting your pet on the appropriate vaccination schedule

classMention.mentionClass: strong communication between you and your LVH veterinarian is the key to getting your pet on the appropriate vaccination schedule

annotation.spannedText: With the facts in hand, you can now feel prepared to discuss the various vaccines or ask questions at your next appointment!

classMention.mentionClass: With the facts in hand, you can now feel prepared to discuss the various vaccines or ask questions at your next appointment!
